title: My Favorite Planty (Plant Inspired) Book Haul from 2020 // Botanically Inspired Book Recommendations

tasks.task: Recommend and discuss eight books related to plants and nature for viewers to read.
subtasks: Begin by introducing the video's purpose and genre (planty book recommendations for the Bloom and Grow YouTube show).
Present and explain the first book, "The Overstory" by Richard Powers, highlighting its impact, structure, and themes.
Discuss the second book, "Catalog of Unabashed Gratitude" by Ross Gay, focusing on the author's poetic style and connection to nature.
Review "The Nature Fix" by Florence Williams, emphasizing its scientific approach to understanding the benefits of nature and its relevance to disconnecting from screens.
Introduce the concept of forest bathing from the book "Forest Bathing" by Dr. Qing Li, explaining its origins, benefits, and practical applications.
Mention a coloring book, "A Girl and Her Plants," by Aisha Richardson, emphasizing its fun and creative aspect for adult coloring enthusiasts.
Discuss "Farming While Black" by Leah Penniman, highlighting its focus on the Black experience in farming and addressing systemic issues.
Recommend "House Plants for All" by Danae Horst, praising its style, care advice, and gift potential.
Introduce "A Family Guide to Terrariums" by Patricia Buzo, emphasizing its educational value for kids and families.

tasks.task: Conclusion and encouragement for viewers to read the recommended books, support local bookstores through affiliate links, and share their own book recommendations.
